title: What's the Jazz song playing in the movie Boomerang? - Quora

response.answer_text: I haven’t seen the movie for so long now but below is the list of all the songs on the soundtrack so go through them and see which one you’re looking for. Tonight Is Right Performed by Keith Washington7 Day Weekend Performed by Grace JonesAtomic Dog Performed by George ClintonString Quartet in G, Opus 54, No. 1 - Third Movement Performed by The Aeolian QuartetIt's Gonna Be Alright Performed by Aaron Hall Featuring Charlie WilsonFeel Like Funkin' It Up Written & Performed by ReBirth Brass Band (as Rebirth Brass Band)Feels Like Heaven Performed by Kenny Vaughan & "The Art of Love"Reversal of a Dog Performed by "The LaFace Cartel" (Damian Dame, Highland Place Mobsters, TLC and Toni Braxton)Pull Up to the Bumper Performed by Grace JonesDon't Wanna Love You Performed by Shanice (as Shanice Wilson)Bewildered Performed by James BrownMagic Tears by Fred SteinerLove Shoulda Brought You Home Performed by Toni BraxtonThere You Go Performed by Johnny GillMan's Final Frontier Performed by Arrested DevelopmentGive U My Heart Performed by Toni Braxton & Kenneth 'Babyface' Edmonds (as Babyface)I'd Die Without You by Prince Be (as Attrel Cordes)

If you’re referringto the music playing in the background, in the scene with Marcus alone in his room after Jacqueline tells him to take a break (and before he accompanies Angela to the kids class), it’s the “Boomerang” movie instrumental/score, recorded by Marcus Miller. Miller later remade it in 2001 as a full song, of the same name, and featured Raphael Saadiq as the vocalist. It appears on his 2002 album “M2”
